TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed StorePermissionFlags extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the permitted access to X.509 certificate stores.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Many of these access permissions pose potential security and privacy threats. Great care should be taken in granting access to stores. A brief description of the type of threat exposed by an access can be found in the summary for the access.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the StorePermissionFlags enumeration.
[!code-cpp[System.Security.Permissions.StorePermission#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.permis_4_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Security.Permissions.StorePermission#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.permis_4_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Permissions.StorePermission#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.permis_4_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.StorePermissionFlags AddToStore = int32(32)

Docs.summary: The ability to add a certificate to a store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For security reasons, this ability should be granted only to highly trusted code.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.StorePermissionFlags AllFlags = int32(247)

Docs.summary: The ability to perform all certificate and store operations.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.StorePermissionFlags CreateStore = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The ability to create a new store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks New stores are created by calling the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Open%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.StorePermissionFlags DeleteStore = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The ability to delete a store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This functionality is not exposed by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.StorePermissionFlags EnumerateCertificates = int32(128)

Docs.summary: The ability to enumerate the certificates in a store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For privacy reasons, this ability should be granted only to fully trusted code.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.StorePermissionFlags EnumerateStores = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The ability to enumerate the stores on a computer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This functionality is not exposed by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.StorePermissionFlags NoFlags = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Permission is not given to perform any certificate or store operations.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.StorePermissionFlags OpenStore = int32(16)

Docs.summary: The ability to open a store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ability to open a store does not include the ability to enumerate certificates (which raises privacy concerns) or to add or remove certificates (which raises security concerns).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.StorePermissionFlags RemoveFromStore = int32(64)

Docs.summary: The ability to remove a certificate from a store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This ability should be granted only to highly trusted code because removing a certificate can result in a denial of service.
